title.value: JANOS: An Integrated Predictive and Prescriptive Modeling Framework
title.justification: The title is prominently displayed at the beginning of the paper and reflects the main focus of the research.
title.quote: JANOS : An Integrated Predictive and Prescriptive Modeling Framework

extractions.description: The paper introduces JANOS, a novel framework that integrates predictive modeling with prescriptive analytics through optimization. The framework supports predictive models such as linear regression, logistic regression, and neural networks (NNs) with ReLU activation functions, embedding these models as constraints in optimization problems. This integration aids in addressing complex decision-making problems by automating the transcription of predictive models into mixed integer programming (MIP) formulations. Demonstrations and evaluations of JANOS are provided, focusing on its efficiency and the improvements it offers in decision-making processes.

type.justification: The paper provides numerical evaluations and experiments to demonstrate the efficiency of the JANOS framework.
type.quote: In this paper, we demonstrate the flexibility of the framework through an example on scholarship allocation in a student enrollment problem and provide a numeric performance evaluation.

name.justification: The paper focuses on integrating machine learning techniques with optimization processes to create a unified framework for predictive and prescriptive analytics.
name.quote: Business research practice is witnessing a surge in the integration of predictive modeling and prescriptive analysis.

name.justification: Neural networks are specifically mentioned as one of the predictive models supported by the framework.
name.quote: JANOS currently supports linear regression, logistic regression, and neural network with rectified linear activation functions.

name.justification: Linear and logistic regression models are supported and used within the framework for predictive modeling.
name.quote: JANOS currently supports predictive models of the following three forms: linear regression, logistic regression, and neural networks (NNs) with rectified linear (ReLU) activation functions.

name.justification: Neural Networks with ReLU activation are explicitly supported and discussed in the context of the framework's capabilities.
name.quote: JANOS currently supports linear regression, logistic regression, and neural network with rectified linear activation functions.

is_contributed.justification: The model is used as part of the framework, not contributed as a new model.
is_contributed.quote: The framework considers two sets of decision variables; regular and predicted. The relationship between the regular and the predicted variables are specified by the user as pre-trained predictive models.

is_executed.justification: The framework describes how the neural network model can be included and used within optimization problems, but does not execute it directly.
is_executed.quote: We do not use the MIP to learn the NN, but rather utilize the network reformulation to produce outputs of the NN based on the input features.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not include any direct performance comparison between neural networks with other models.
is_compared.quote: JANOS provides a parameterized discretization for handling logistic regression prediction.

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep neural networks as 0-1 mixed integer linear programs: A feasibility study
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference is related to the use of MIP in transforming neural network outputs.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Fischetti M, Jo J (2017) Deep neural networks as 0-1 mixed integer linear programs: A feasibility study.

name.justification: Linear regression is one of the predictive models supported by JANOS for optimization-based predictive modeling.
name.quote: JANOS currently supports predictive models of the following three forms: linear regression, logistic regression, and neural networks (NNs) with rectified linear (ReLU) activation functions.

is_contributed.justification: The model is utilized from existing methodologies within the framework, not a new contribution.
is_contributed.quote: The framework considers two sets of decision variables; regular and predicted. The relationship between the regular and the predicted variables are specified by the user as pre-trained predictive models.

is_executed.justification: The paper describes the support for linear regression in the framework, not a direct execution of the model itself.
is_executed.quote: We construct (PROBLEM-ORI) and feed the model to Gurobi.

is_compared.justification: Linear regression is evaluated in comparison to other models in terms of runtime efficiency within the framework.
is_compared.quote: LinReg yields the most efficient model, taking up to a second to solve.

referenced_paper_title.value: Efficient and robust automated machine learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference is relevant due to its relation to machine learning models optimization processes.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Feurer M, Klein A, Eggensperger K, Springenberg J, Blum M, Hutter F (2015) Efficient and robust automated machine learning.

name.justification: Logistic regression is included as one of the models supported by the framework for embedding into optimization problems.
name.quote: JANOS currently supports predictive models of the following three forms: linear regression, logistic regression, and neural networks (NNs) with rectified linear (ReLU) activation functions.

is_contributed.justification: Logistic regression is a pre-existing model that is utilized within the JANOS framework, not newly contributed.
is_contributed.quote: The framework considers two sets of decision variables; regular and predicted. The relationship between the regular and the predicted variables are specified by the user as pre-trained predictive models.

is_executed.justification: The framework provides methods for including logistic regression into optimization problems, but does not execute it as a standalone.
is_executed.quote: We partition the range of the log-odds into âˆ† intervals.

is_compared.justification: The efficiency and accuracy of logistic regression are compared within different configurations and against other models in the paper.
is_compared.quote: For the logistic regression model, the main parameter of interest is the number of intervals in the discretization.

referenced_paper_title.value: An interior-point method for large-scale l1-regularized logistic regression
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference discusses methods relevant to the optimization-based handling of logistic regression models.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Koh K, Kim SJ, Boyd S (2007) An interior-point method for large-scale l1-regularized logistic regression.

name.justification: The Gurobi Optimizer is specified as a required tool for solving mixed integer programming (MIP) problems within the framework.
name.quote: The framework, which we call JANOS 1, is built in Python and calls Gurobi (Gurobi Optimization 2019) to solve MIPs.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Gurobi Optimizer manual is referenced as the source for understanding the tool's capabilities and applications.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Gurobi Optimization L (2019) Gurobi optimizer reference manual.

name.justification: Scikit-learn is mentioned as a library used for pre-training predictive models like linear regression and logistic regression models within the experiments.
name.quote: All predictive models were built in Python3.7 using scikit-learn 0.21.3 (Pedregosa et al. 2011).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference provides details on scikit-learn, the Python library used for implementing machine learning models in the research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Pedregosa F, Varoquaux G, Gramfort A, Michel V, Thirion B, Grisel O, Blondel M, Prettenhofer P, Weiss R, Dubourg V, Vanderplas J, Passos A, Cournapeau D, Brucher M, Perrot M, Duchesnay E (2011) Scikit-learn: Machine Learning in Python .
